desc: We will be accepting video submissions from our certificants (via DropBox) for a dog training video contest.  The certificants will submit raw footage in three 5 minute videos or one 15 minute video.  We require the winning video to edited into a 5 minute video including graphics, information and sound.The information below is for our certificants (members) to enter to give more information.CCPDT Certificant Video Contest!Are you a CCPDT certificant who loves communicating with clients about how to make their dogs more successful through science-based training? Do you have a unique way of making training fun? Do you want to help dog owners learn a new trick? Then we want you to show us what you’ve got!In our Summer CCPDT Certificant Video Contest  we’ll ask you to show off your skills by submitting a 5 minute video of you training a dog to do a designated behavior or explaining a basic training concept or the solution to a common behavior issue.  Our favorite will be used for educational purposes and promotion by the CCPDT featuring YOU and your business! To sweeten the pot, we’ll also reinforce you with a $50 Amazon gift card. . . that way you can buy some more of the cool dog training swag that we know you’ve been eyeing up!So grab your cameras and get to training, we can’t wait to see what you can do!Submission Deadline:Thursday August 31, 2017Topic:We'd like to see how you would counsel a client through the common behavior issue of Counter Surfing!  In 5 minutes or less, show us your best tips and tricks for keeping food on your table and out of your dog's mouth.General Information & TipsPlease submit your videos via the method listed below only, all other submissions will not be acceptedVideo(s) should follow/demonstrate the three following applications:Demonstration of the Unwanted BehaviourManagement and/or Training StrategiesFollow up and results of the management and/or training strategiesDo not edit the videos to add graphics, text, music or subtitlesShould we decide to utilize your video, we will feature and credit you and your associated organizations in the final product, and in all further distributionPlease take into consideration filming conditions in order to present a video that is visually and audibly clearBefore submission, ensure that anyone speaking in the video can clearly be heardHave fun and smile! This is your playing field so show off your skills!Submission GuidelinesVideo(s) must be submitted via Dropbox upload and shared with  administrator@[url removed, login to view]1 to 3 videos should be submitted as raw footage. (combined or separate videos must not exceed 15 minutes total footage)Videos should be formatted as .AVI, .MPEG4, .MOV, .MPEGPS or .WMV.Rules & EligibilitySubmissions will only be accepted from current certificants in good standing who hold one of our three designations (CPDT-KA, CPDT-KSA and CBCC-KA)All videos must follow the Humane Hierarchy position statement as set forth by the  CCPDTAll videos must be received by the submission deadline. Late submissions will not be consideredUpon submission, all videos become the property of the CCPDTThrough submission of videos to the CCPDT Certificant Video Contest, the owner of the videos releases all rights and permissions to the CCPDT for use of the video for promotional useOnce submitted, videos will be edited to fit time constraints and add visual and audio effects
title: www.ccpdt.org

desc: First go to [url removed, login to view] After reading the front page, open the instructions tab and study.Then visit this youtube address: [url removed, login to view]Finally visit this URL: [url removed, login to view] What you see is the Kitty Whiz Transfer System.  I invented this industry with this product. All of the other products are copies and in some cases exact copies of Kitty Whiz and all of them are probematic, just like Kitty Whiz. In a large percentage of the cases they leave the cat only partially toilet trained or still dependent on the litter box.Bye, Bye Litter is different: It is a multi-level, 6 tray system.  The single level systems work by cutting out larger and larger holes in the center of the trays. When cats get to the second or third opening, they get confused and after prancing back and forth for about a minute, the hop off the toilet and poop on the floor. https://www.google.com/#q=citi+citty+poop+on+floorThat doesn't happen with Bye, Bye Litter. So I want to show a side by side animation of a single tray system with a confused cat after they cut out the second or third section. Then how the bye system the cat can always see litter on the lower level as the top level is opened. Resulting in 100% of cats that can hop up on a toilet being successfully completely toilet trained. Where the single tray systems, the cat ends up reverting back to a germ, virus, parasite infested litter box.There are 2 different animations. each need to be a minuteQuality like Pixar movie
title: I would like to hire an Animator

desc: We need to upgrade from WowzaMediaServer-2.2.4 to latest version on AWS.We have an application that has been using WowzaMediaServer-2.2.4 for part of its stream connections for our collaboration app called Studiopass. Recently Amazon has decided to remove DevPay which means we must spin up a new instance of Wowza which will have the latest version of the Wowza. This new instance has been created. We need to examine the current running WowzaMediaServer-2.2.4 and move our custom code from that server to the new Wowza instance and test to make sure its working correctly. After this task, we will have other Wowza related new features we would like to add.
